activities.loc: Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance, Room 121

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Botwright

Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance

Defendant appears by Zoom from Calumet County Jail,
Defendant waives personal appearance,

Court finds probable cause,
Defendant bound over,
Information filed - waives reading,
Not guilty pleas entered.

Transcript of  Return on Warrant hearing held 08/16/22

Transcript of Initial Appearance held 07/25/22

961.41(3g)(am) - Possession of Narcotic Drugs
961.573(1) - Possession of Drug Paraphernalia 

Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes, without a valid prescription. 
Drug monitoring patch shall be installed by a vendor approved by the court before release from jail.
Shall comply with all rules established by the drug monitoring patch vendor.
Shall not remove or otherwise tamper with the drug monitoring patch.  The drug monitoring patch may only be removed by the vendor. 
Shall not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court. 
Shall not apply for a passport while case is pending.
Calumet County Sheriff's Department Warrant Cancellation

Defendant appears by video from Calumet County Jail,
Warrant quashed,
$1,500 Cash Bond ordered.
